Description: Counting same record multiple times due to duplicates or join multiplication
Symptoms: Total much higher than expected; sum doesn't match source
Prevention Query: SELECT id, COUNT(*) as cnt FROM table GROUP BY id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
User Question: Does the total of X seem reasonable compared to other reports?

Description: Aggregating at wrong level (user vs session vs event)
Symptoms: Numbers don't match other reports; unexpected row counts
Prevention Query: SELECT COUNT(*), COUNT(DISTINCT user_id), COUNT(DISTINCT session_id) FROM table
User Question: Is this data one row per user, per session, or per event?

Description: Only analyzing users who completed journey ignoring dropoffs
Symptoms: Metrics look too good; missing failed attempts
Prevention Query: Check: are we only looking at users who converted?
User Question: Are we analyzing all users or only those who [completed action]?

Description: Aggregate trend opposite of subgroup trends
Symptoms: Conflicting conclusions; unexpected direction
Prevention Query: Compare aggregate vs segment-level trends

Description: Comparing full period to partial period
Symptoms: Latest period looks lower than historical
Prevention Query: Check if latest period has full data: WHERE date < current_date
User Question: Is the latest time period complete, or should we exclude it?

Description: Using INNER when LEFT needed or vice versa
Symptoms: Missing rows; unexpected nulls; row count changes
Prevention Query: Compare row counts before and after join
User Question: The join produced X rows from Y original rows. Does this match expectation?

Description: NULLs excluded from aggregations unexpectedly
Symptoms: Lower counts than expected; divisions by zero
Prevention Query: SELECT COUNT(*), COUNT(column), SUM(CASE WHEN column IS NULL THEN 1 END)
User Question: How should we handle missing/null values in this analysis?

Description: BETWEEN includes endpoints; wrong date boundary
Symptoms: One extra or missing day; period mismatch
Prevention Query: Check: date >= start AND date < end (exclusive end)
User Question: Should the date range include or exclude the end date?

Description: Using different definition than stakeholder expects
Symptoms: Numbers don't match expectations; confusion
Prevention Query: Document exact definition before starting
User Question: How does your team define [metric]? What's included/excluded?

Description: Mixing dollars and cents or different currencies
Symptoms: Numbers off by factor of 100 or exchange rate
Prevention Query: Check: are amounts in dollars or cents? One currency?
User Question: Are these amounts in dollars or cents? Same currency throughout?

Description: Comparing periods with different seasonal patterns
Symptoms: Invalid conclusions; unfair comparisons
Prevention Query: Compare same period last year, not sequential periods
User Question: Should we compare to same period last year to account for seasonality?

Description: Analyzing non-representative sample
Symptoms: Conclusions don't generalize; biased insights
Prevention Query: Check how sample was selected; compare to population
User Question: Is this sample representative of all users, or a specific subset?

Description: Claiming causation from correlation
Symptoms: Incorrect business recommendations
Prevention Query: Check: is there a plausible mechanism? Control for confounders?
User Question: Does X actually cause Y, or are they just correlated?

Description: Choosing date range that shows desired narrative
Symptoms: Misleading conclusions; not reproducible
Prevention Query: Use standard reporting periods; document why dates chosen
User Question: Why was this specific date range chosen?

Description: Comparing metrics calculated at different levels
Symptoms: Apples to oranges comparison; invalid conclusions
Prevention Query: Ensure both metrics use same denominator/level
User Question: Are both these metrics calculated the same way (same level)?

Description: Using stale data that hasn't propagated fully
Symptoms: Recent periods look incomplete; inconsistent

User Question: Is this data fully loaded? When was it last updated?

Description: Wrong formula for complex metrics
Symptoms: Metrics don't match known correct values
Prevention Query: Validate against known correct calculation or source
User Question: Can we validate this against another source or manual calculation?

Symptoms: Misleading visualizations; wrong conclusions
